author: Lewyb
title: Exceptional and helpful staff
body: I have been receiving immunotherapy at Woodend Hospital in Aberdeen for the last 2 years, and have benefitted greatly from it. The staff have been exceptional and so helpful!

readBy.name: Aberdeen City Health & Social Care Partnership

title: Great Practice
body: I recently visited the surgery twice in one week. The receptionist was extremely helpful both times, whilst multi-tasking, answering the phone and dealing with other patients as they came in she managed to help me complete the form I was filling in and reassure me that she would pass everything on to the relevant department. She was friendly professional and caring.

author: DW63
title: Wonderful staff
body: I have just had a CT scan at Wycombe hospital, and I wanted to commend and thank the young lady and gentleman who carried out the procedure. They were both efficient and utterly charming- thank you very much.

author: handsetyh38
title: Nuisance from patients' phones
body:
I was taken into the Ninewells ASRU for an appendix operation.  
I had my phone on all the time in my stay at Ninewells, but I kept it on mute with the vibration alert also off. I therefore didn't annoy other patients or disturb the business of the ward.  
However, I was twice woken in the night by message alerts on another patient's phone. Ironically, the other patient didn't wake up! I got up and asked the nurse to quietly have a word with the patient when they woke up, and request that the phone be muted.  
Either that didn't happen, or the patient didn't care, as during the following day, the ward was frequently disturbed by message alerts, incoming calls and loudspeaker enhanced outgoing calls.  
I would therefore recommend that posters are plastered around wards, visible to all patients, requesting that phones are kept on mute with vibration alert suppressed and that, when making or receiving calls, the loudspeaker function is not used.  
Patients will still be able to see that messages have arrived and respond to them. Their phones will light up when someone calls and they could still answer it, just not on loudspeaker.

author: Yashfa
title: No answer to calls and no appointment
body: Hi, My medication increased in February 2021. I am diabetic, have got high blood pressure and I suffer from high cholesterol levels. My medication has been giving me side effects. Every single day I ring the surgery and I am in the que, but when my number comes into the que, the call drops. Because of my diabetes, I have got a lump on my feet and I can't see the doctor. I am waiting for my next diabetic check in December with the nurse.

author: Hugh61
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Help given by the Sensory team in Derry
body:
I have been very isolated and depressed over a number of years. I am Deaf sign language user with very few people in my life. Over past 3 months my life has changed so much thanks to the support of the staff at the Sensory Team. I have been given a smart phone and training and can now use WhatsApp Video to communicate with my family.  
I joined a four week Men's Deaf club where I made new friends. I am now looking forward to joining activities in the Day Centre. I am delighted and can't thank staff enough for encouraging me.  
**Video of story in BSL **  
This is a translation by a BSL translator  
[https://vimeo.com/838200491](https://vimeo.com/838200491)  
**Video of story in ISL**  
This is a translation by an ISL translator  
[https://vimeo.com/839983572](https://vimeo.com/839983572)

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fantastic Staff
body: The reception staff are helpful and efficient.  I had a telephone triage and same day face to face appointment.  The GP was thorough, explained the findings and was reassuring but honest.  I needed to contact the secretaries, who were also helpful and efficient .  Fantastic service from all the staff at Ladybarn GP.

author: woodpeckerxx68
title: Wasting resources
body:
The nurse was very nice who dealt with me but the nurse practitioner was not friendly at all and showed no empathy whatsoever in the way they spoke to me and dealt with me. They didnâ€™t smile, were not friendly, and were as quick as they could be to do what they had to do. There were no other patients in the Department or waiting to be seen.  
Following the X-ray I was dealt with a little better prior to discharge, although I was given a card to phone first in future should I ever need to come back for any reason. I had phoned first and I was told the last appointment for the day had been taken, so I took a chance and went anyway. Whilst I was there like I said above there were no patients in the Department and none waiting to be seen in the waiting room.  
So if last appointment was at 4 and that person had been seen and discharged and the service is based on appointments alone, there appear to be 2 nurse practitioners and nurse sitting there with little or nothing to do. Therefore the phone first service is wasting resources.  
I was told last appointment was at 4 and I would have to go the following day at 9 am, yet I went anyway and was in and out in 20 mins!

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Aoiyf36
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Elbow Problems
body: Last Saturday I came into hospital with extreme elbow pains and problems. I was approached quickly and dealt with. Communication from staff has been overall great could not fault it. The staff are very pleasant and would come in regularly to see check up on me which is very comforting. I would like to thank them greatly for what they have done. Food has been great would actually prefer it over my own food!

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Booking system needs improving
body: Need to make the booking process a bit better as u need to call on day and all appointments go really quick. Should have longer dates made available on online booking system

title: Awful service
body: I have repeatedly received terrible service, mainly from the reception staff. They booked me in to have a blood test done over a telephone appointment, I was then booked in for the blood test results without having the blood test itself, I was told I would have blood test forms posted out to me that I never received, I was told my partner could collect the blood test forms and he couldn't. Every single time I call up the surgery for whatever reason the service is less than satisfactory. Previously I was promised a telephone appointment that never happened and when challenged the man on reception explained that whilst he had promised me a telephone appointment, after the call his manager advised him that this was not possible however he did not think it was necessary to call back and explain this to me, instead I was just left waiting for the call and having to call up to find out why I never got it. Dealing with this surgery is seriously frustrating.

author: Aoiyf36
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Care has been exceptional
body:
I have arrived in today due to my child not feeling well. At the moment they are doing tests and monitoring her as they are unsure what is the exact problem.  
The care they are getting in Blossom is excellent. The staff are invariably friendly, helpful and efficient. They have kept me informed and have really comforted me. I greatly appreciate their hard work.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Aoiyf36
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Brilliant and friendly staff
body:
Came into Craigavon Hospital on Monday night as my child was suffering very badly with asthma and bronchiolitis. We were seen quick enough.  
In blossom the staff have all been great, they are very friendly and brilliant at there job. They have had great care and and could not fault them. I believe there would be no improvements to be made in my opinion.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Horrible receptionists
body: We moved from the Wonderful Cobbs Garden Surgery, Olney to Asplands in 2017 when we moved house. Nothing to do with overworked due to covid as these receptionists have been rude from the day we joined. Extremely rude when dealing with any query you may have, sighing on the other end of the line when you pursue what it is your trying to get sorted as if you are really putting them out as they have better things to do. Such a shame as when you do see a Doctor they all seem lovely & helpful. Why nothing is done about these constant bad reviews of receptionists behaviour is beyond me as Iâ€™m sure there would be a long line of patient, friendly & accommodating people looking for a job at your practice.

author: Aoiyf36
authorRole: a staff member posting for a carer/relative
title: Helpful and caring nurses
body:
We came to Craigavon Area Hospital's Emergency Department as my child was suffering pneumonia. ED was quite busy but overall it was okay.  
The nurses in Blossom have been very helpful and caring. They really are very professional and brilliant at what they do!  
I did feel as if some of the doctors were not very approachable, which made me feel uncomfortable asking questions.  
Cleanliness of the hospital is at good standard.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Aoiyf36
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Amazing staff
body:
I came into hospital as I needed an emergency trachea. The treatment that I have been receiving in Craigavon Area Hospital has been amazing, staff have been extraordinary. I have bad hearing and it is also hard for me to speak so communication is okay but the staff are able to overcome this barrier.  
Even the cleanliness of my room has been great, you can tell they are doing a good job by the shine of the taps!  
I do not believe that there could be any improvements everyone is just great.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Dreadful customer service
body: I needed medication for a continuing medical problem I have had during my adult life. I was not seeking to an appointment, as I am well aware of the treatment I needed to recover. After waiting over 30 mins. being 'caller no. 1',a receptionist finally answered. She was very dismissive, did not ask what the problem was, suggested I could not have had previously prescribed medication without seeing a doctor. She went on to say that the first available appt. I could have would be 5 days later, again as I am well aware of my ongoing condition, I said that would leave my 5 days in pain and then possibly 2 more days before any medication would take effect. She then suggested I could see a doctor the following day! I found her manner totally unacceptable and borderline rude. I do hope calls are monitored, as this member of staff could certainly do with some extra training on how to deal with a distressed customer. I was left feeling humiliated, let down and most of all upset and angry, all of which could have been avoided by a more caring, professional individual. To end on a more positive note, the doctor I did see was exceptional, in these difficult and demanding times for all, she made time to listen and was supportive about my feelings concerning the receptionist I had the misfortune to deal with. Thank you to the doctor.

title: Great practice
body: I have been registered with this practice  for a few years  and i have found them to be very helpful and overall a good surgery. The reception staff have always been helpful here since i registered  and they are welcoming which i didnt have in my last practice this makes such a difference .  Well done primrose surgery bd3 thank you for your care and support fot us patients.

author: Pink42
title: Domestic abuse anxiety mental health issues emotions  controlling my anger
body: When i first started my counselling.My head was very messed up due to the domestic abuse i received for my ex husband of 15 year.seen then i have come so far in the last 8months and my 12 week programme with this service.i have learnt to control my mood to different skill to keep my emotions and my temper at bay.i have also had a little girl in August and it is a wonderful out come because i got to take her home as i worked so hard with social workers counselling probation.and it has all help me get though the hard time And the difficulties that were going on drug use alcohol abuse now i feel like a new person my head is clear and i have a chance to be a worthy sensible person with all the help.But you do have to put the work in or you wont benefit from the program and it is tough talking about the death of a loved one its not going to work if you dont open up to professional that can really help and benefit from.Now my anxiety is slowly reducing my moods are control by medication and i am clean of drugs and alcohol and i feel free at last from all the bad things in my life now i have a life to look forward to.Never give up never give up you will get there it does take time to heal and it also is hard at times with the questions but i promise you can change if you really want to.And there is help just ask i did.and i have taken away many many skills and how to cope with day to day.

author: Monrz98
title: Birth of my first child
body: My son was born in Craigavon at 37 weeks. I had preeclampsia which led to me being induced and ultimately an emergency section. Micah also had some jaundice which led to quite a long stay. I'd like to say how much I appreciate all the care and support I received at the maternity ward. I can't remember all of the names but in particular I'd like to thank the midwives in 2 West who looked after us - Rachael, Cherry, Cherith, Ashleigh and others who were so helpful. I'd also like to thank all the domestic staff who kept us fed and watered and were always so kind and attentive. The nurses were also so helpful supportive and attentive during our stay. In the delivery suite, things got pretty stressful but the care we received was second to none - Dr Khan did an amazing job in keeping us informed, communicating the available options and giving me back control by asking me what I wanted - I appreciated that so much. I'd also like to single out Ann who looked after me all day after induction, and Orla and Fionnula who were there for us all night and through to the morning after my son was born. I was pretty out of it so can't remember everything you did for us but I know you ensured that our baby was delivered safely and I'm so grateful to you. Thank you all so much.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Hideous and unfit for purpose practice
body: Utterly impossible to get through to the reception, obtain an in person appointment, or God forbid rectify issues dating back as far as 2019. I did not choose this practice, but was forced there under Covid "polyclinic" changes. Have lost approximately 4 hours online and on the phone this week to book basic appt and make an enquiry (which FYI cannot be done in the same call) . Takes 45 minutes minimum to get through and a lifetime to get anything resolved. Patients are wfh, caring for complex needs children and delivering isolation learning, nobody has time for this, don't even bother using digital messages, nobody ever gets back to you within any time frame. I am at my wits end, if i thought I would ever get through to a practice manager I'd try a call, but yeah what would be the point. Epic fail this system which serves nobody. Infuriatingly incompetent and impossible to obtain support, currently on hold for the fifth time today, number 9 in the queue and the call just dropped. Stop this world I want to get off.

title: Very helpful
body: Would just to say thank you for being a big help to me with me getting my right vaccine,very pleasant lady's and helpful,so thanks again most appropriatedðŸ˜Š

title: Cannot answer phones or call you back
body:
Tried all day to contact them by phone, on hold, requested call back, no one got back to me.
Never used to be like this.

title: Proactive treatment
body: Attended for series of blood tests only rang Dr on Monday and received a call on Wednesday. Nurse who attended me extremely helpful, kind and able. Alerted me to treatment I needed as an over 65 and explained booking procedure.

author: Aoiyf36
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Put at ease
body: I arrived last week as I have been feeling very unwell. When I came into the hospital I felt very anxious as I was not sure why I was feeling so unwell, however the day nurse was able to reassure and put me at ease. She is very good and you can tell that she is passionate about her job! The cleanliness of the hospital is great which is comforting to see during these times. Food and bedding is also at a good standard.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Usually adequate not so much lately
body: Have been with this group of surgeries for the past 6 years and have until now never needed the care of a GP. I did an initial Econsult which was very thorough although I did find it a little frustrating as the questions seemed to be repeating themselves however I got a call shortly after asking if I would prefer a call am or pm the next working day which was great. On the day of the call I received a text saying systems were down and it would have to be rescheduled. at which point more than a few choice words were screamed due to sheer frustration however within a couple of hours I did receive the call from a very nice doctor which was a little shock as website still reported much later in the day that systems were down and given a prescription and told to get back in touch if it didnâ€™t work. It worked somewhat so I did another E-Consult this time I just got an email saying someone would be in touch by 6.30 the next working day, this didnâ€™t happen so thereâ€™s a part on the email you can send a response saying you havenâ€™t contacted me so itâ€™s now approaching 6.30 two days after the second e-consult and still no contact. Iâ€™m loathe to try and call them in case they try and contact me while Iâ€™m trying to get hold of them but nevertheless tried a couple of times with no success. I really am at my wits end now I donâ€™t believe they have any intention of contacting me I feel totally let down. I appreciate how busy they must be but I feel invisible to them I know from my partners recent experience at the surgery if you do mange to get in there is hardly anyone in there so what exactly they are doing is still a mystery. I hope the situation improves but I lack confidence it will. Fingers crossed they prove me wrong.

title: Covid Booster
body:
I had my Covid Booster recently. It was all very well run. I enquired about having the flu vaccine & a lady took my details & said I would be contacted. I was within a short time & have now had that too.
 Well done !

author: Father Ted%
title: Lack of ongoing treatment plan
body:
I recently suffered from extreme pain in my right hip extending down my leg.  
The pain was excruciating and after two calls to my GP I was admitted to East Surrey Hospital Redhill via ambulance. During my stay I was given pain relief which was brought under control after 24hrs .  
The reason of writing my story is not to complain in any way with the treatment I receive but the lack of any treatment plan to resolve my issues.  
During my stay a couple of possible diagnosis were put forward but at no time did the team suggest an MRI scan, this I put forward as in my view was the only way to identify the problem. This was finally excepted just prior to my release from hospital , you can see from the wording on my discharge papers ,' Mr ? has agreed to a MRI scan. Not Mr ?? has requested .  
I have had and continue to suffer from pain in my hip and leg.( 7 weeks on)  
I have now had the MRI and follow up appointment with the fracture clinic where I had further x-rays on my thigh . As a result of these x-rays which potential show a tumour, the consultant has put me forward for another MRI as the first one ordered didn't cover this area.  
My experience shows a reluctance to use all options available i.e. MRI scan at the time of my hospital stay and the boundaries applied to the scan once agreed.  
I am now having to wait for the second scan and follow up appointment.  
This is obviously having an effect on my mental health and wellbeing due to any sign of a treatment plan 7 weeks on ,it is also a waste of NHS resources, with two separate scans , two outpatient appointments, which is really the point of this letter.  
Signed, hoping for a clear scan!!!!  
,

readBy.name: Surrey and Sussex Healthcare NHS Trust

author: Pat24
title: Day Surgery Unit
body:
I attended Wishaw Day Surgery unit and just wanted to say how fantastic the nursing staff were - I was there for 12 hours and they were brilliant. They were so attentive to every patient there and I could not fault them. A special thank you to Amy, Gwen and Tracey who took excellent care of my.  
I also want to say a massive thank you to the anaesthetic team who took great care of me throughout.

author: equuleuskb33
title: The staff
body:
Great experience start to finish, unfortunately I cannot remember the lady that helped me at the health centre, but she made me feel at ease, was great informal yet filled with important information. 

Jake was a great guy too on the phone really professional too and really put me at ease. 

Great service highly recommend.

author: connie91
title: Treliske Birth Unit
body:
I spent four days in Treliske between Wheal Rose, the delivery suite and Wheal Fortune wards for the birth of my first child.  
The care I received was absolutely incredible from start to finish.  
Every member of staff put me at the centre of the care, I felt listened to and cared for.  
All staff members were so caring, they couldn't do enough for me.  
There was such a high level of professionalism throughout, I felt safe and reassured.  
Although my labour was long and drawn out, being in Treliske was a positive experience. I would tell anyone to go there to have their children and I would definitely go back there a second time.  
I think everyone needs to know how amazing the birth service is at RCHT!

author: funnyzf46
title: I was well taken care of
body: I went for an 40s health check.The nurse was extremely patient,professional and attentive. I was offered a second jab for covid on the day eventhough i was scheduled for one 2 days later .All the other staff were pleasant too and i felt like an appreciated citizen in my  registered surgery

author: flutemy95
title: Hospital visit
body: [Very happy with 'Treatment']

author: R902
title: Trip to Minor injuries unit - Keep up the great work
body: Iâ€™d like to thank the staff in the Mid Ulster Minor Injuries unit, from the receptionist staffing, nurses and X-ray team. This service is a credit to the community of the Magherafelt area. From the moment I arrived till the moment I left the department, I was very well taken care of. Especially by Staff Nurse Sandra and Nurse Practitioner Sean. You definitely are a credit to yourselves and the mid Ulster community. Keep up the great work!

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Jimster
title: wonderful care
body: My wife was in hospital for lung problems and care and staff were wonderful. We would like to be able to give support to hospital to indicate our great experience to counter the negative publicity due to alleged ventilation problems.

author: LW17
title: Seamless care for Daughters recent admission.
body:
My daughter recently fell off the bed sustaining a minor head injury. She seemed fine. When early the next morning (3am) she started vomiting I called 111. I spoke with a fantastic call handler called Chris who was calm, friendly and put me at ease. He spoke with a nurse and the decision was made to send us to UHW ED. My daughter was very quickly triaged by a lovely nurse Janice and then seen quickly by Dr Patrick. It was busy but they saw her quickly. It was decided that a CT scan was required. This showed potential inflammation/infection to the bone behind her ear. Not related to the head injury. Within hours we were seen by Dr Nick from UHM Monklands ENT dept. She was admitted to the paediatric ward for 24hrs abx and obs. The next morning we had a ENT consultation with Dr Iyers. She was discharged home with follow up meds and OP appointment. Seamless care.  
From start to finish her care was exceptional. From Chris the call handler, ED Dr Patrick, Dr Val, Dr David, ED nursed Janice, Nicola M, Mark, ENT consutants Dr Nick and Dr Arun, Ward 19 Dr David, Nurse Eleanor, Ward 20 nightshift nurse Ashley(this nurse was an angel and never stopped the whole night), Nurse Megan and even the domestic on ward 20 had the loveliest way with the children.  
Both ED and ward 20 were extremely busy but we never felt like a bother. All staff introduced themselves, spoke directly to my young daughter and treated both us and her with kindness and respect.  
It's easy to see the negatives in current times but all we witnessed was kindness and positivity from very hard worked staff.  
These members of staff deserve nothing but praise and Thank you just does not seem enough.

author: Rs19
title: Peterhead community maternity unit
body:
I gave birth in the Peterhead Maternity unit last month and honestly can't praise all of the staff enough. I was initially a bit anxious about giving birth at a midwife led unit but i really had no reason to worry. The care I have received throughout my pregnancy has been great and all of the team when I was in labour were amazing. I am a first time mum and was pretty clueless when it came to it all and all of the midwives were so reassuring and able to advise me on all of the questions I had. The midwives were so supportive during my labour and really helped me through especially with my husbands little incident. (Which makes a great story now ha)  
There was a student midwife working and you would never have thought she was a student, she was very great and able to answer all of my questions. I was in overnight in the hospital and again the care we both received was great inckuding support to breast feed. After I was home again the support was great, I had regular visits from various midwifes who were very supportive and able to help me with feeding and questions I had. If you have any doubts about going to a midwife led unit please don't they are fantastic! Thank you all so much again!

author: MoniqueLP
title: Great service from Dr
body:
After having been to another surgery to try and get my contraceptive implant removed twice (which the GP had struggled to remove), I was then referred to the Lawson Practice. 

Dr Shabana was polite, welcoming and made me feel at ease. She managed to get the implant out in under 6 minutes! I canâ€™t thank her enough - third time lucky!! 

Great service! Would definitely recommend her to my family members and friends.

author: Nana banana!
title: Ulster Hospital Breast Clinic
body: I first discovered a breast lump mid September and, despite Covid regulations, I received an appointment within less than 5 weeks.   From the very first day, attending the Clinic has been like going to visit friends.    The staff are amazing people, always smiling, caring and putting patients at ease.  I had surgery at the Day Procedure Unit two weeks ago, have had follow up appointment explaining Pathology report; been referred now to The City Hospital for Radiotherapy.   Professor Kirk, his team, and every member of staff I have encountered along the way, have been brilliant.  The journey isn't over yet but I know I have the best care team.     Thank you each and every one.    You are wonderful.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: SigmaM7
title: Self-Awareness
body:
Battling stress/anxiety at Work.  
I felt limited in the sense where I felt My stomach was in my mouth and I was unable to speak fluently as per normal. I felt uncomfortable to the point being within the environment felt like too much pressure.  
I am confidently aware of my emotion, thoughts, behaviour, and attitude on a daily basis however experiencing not being able to talk or string along a couple of words, I genuinely felt I needed some form of help. I needed help to help me to understand the route cause of the problem for example; why it has happened to me, what has changed, and what outside force/source played a part?!  
Having enrolled in the IAP service; Overcoming worry group has helped benefited me through the ways of using CBT (Cognitive Behavioural Therapy) and Areas Model when going through an episode of anxiety/stress (They were more techniques however these made logical sense). It has allowed me to break down in detail the cause of any situation by analysing the event, my thoughts, Emotion, Physical Symptoms, and behaviour.As of late, I have trialed their suggestion for the past month and I have seen an improvement in my attitude and how I can control or manage my stress/anxiety in given situations.Note to anyone reading going through anything, please seek help where possible. We are all human beings with a brain, mouth, hands, ears, organs, etc..and we are all different in our own way!Taking care of your mental health is as vital as taking care of your health - dont be shy please!Special thanks to Khensa and her team for the excellent service they have provided. A great example of clinicians who are there to help whatever the cause may be.

author: guest123
title: Spoken to as a human
body:
I attended my first Inclusion ACT Session & I really appreciate the services being offered. The session was interesting & varied as well as asking for our own thoughts on things.  
Thanks for listening.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)

author: humanitiesdb43
title: Kind, friendly staff
body: I was dreading my urology appointment today, very nervous about the unknown. I was greeted by a lovely health care worker by the name of Julie. She reassured me and explained everything that would happened today and the results of the test. Lovely, kind and friendly is how I would describe her and Iâ€™m for ever appreciative and would like to past on my thanks.

author: Emilyethan
title: My stay at Wishaw maternity unit
body: I was a patient at the Wishaw maternity unit at the end of September 2021. My baby was breech therefore I opted for an elective section. I would like to say a big Thankyou to all the maternity team at Wishaw.. my consultant Dr Malcolm his associates...the midwives, theatre nurses, csw and hostesses. The team start to finish were incredible...I can't remember everyone's names individually, as I was a bit hazy during and after surgery...but I would like to say a huge thank you to the nurse who was by my husband Adrian and my side during my procedure...you are the definition of nurse!! You were exceptional. I was a very nervous patient, you picked up on this and you got me through a very scared and emotional time. I will never forget how you made me feel. This was my first baby and I was out of my comfort zone. As a health care professional, I understand the pressures the NHS faces daily. However, this did not affect the care that I received. You all do an amazing job and I will never forget my time or experience thank-you once again. And keep doing the amazing job you do.

author: Supracat
title: Excellent care
body: I attended Forth Valley Hospital for a small procedure and was made to feel very at ease by David, Rona and laura in the Ambulatory Care team throughout my visit. I was a little anxious but the team helped me through it with their chat and at all times I was made to feel special and safe in their care.

author: tartan100
title: Lorn & Islands hospital publishing out of date telephone number
body:
I am not sure when NHS Highland Lorn & Islands hospital changed their local telephone number to a Glasgow number, but whenever it was, the information has still not been updated on the NHS Highland website. https://www.nhshighland.scot.nhs.uk/services/pages/lornislandsdistrictgeneralhospital.aspx  
When you phone the local number a voice message says the number is no longer available and you need to phone a glasgow number (provides the number). Please can you see if you can get the NHS Highland to update the hospital website accordingly.  
Thank you

author: TraceC
title: Relaxing Reiki treatment
body:
Craig who provides the Reiki treatment at the Fern Centre has been visiting me whilst having chemotherapy.  
All I can say is Craig has wonder healing hands. He is so calm & considerate, which makes for a very relaxing session and i look forward to seeing him. Reiki can be a great stress relief be it if you don't like needles or just generally anxious & if you are feeling like that, the Craig is you man.  
Can't recommend highly enough.  
Thank you!!

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: patients dad
title: Wonderful GP care
body:
Having experienced a range on worsening symptoms over a period of weeks/months I made an appointment with my local GP practice. This was initially over the phone but Dr Box was keen to see me in person and got me in the next day. He really took my situation seriously and I felt heard. He organised additional investigations immediately. I made a 2nd appointment as symptoms got worse and saw Dr Singupta who has been looking after me now for 3 months. As with Dr Box, he listens, is attentive and it feels like he has been doing everything he can to investigate my symptoms as well as manage them. We're not at the bottom of my situation yet but I feel strongly that the care and dedication shown by the GPs including their wider healthcare and supportive admin team really need to be recognised for their excellent care.  
Dr Singupta has followed me up regularly via the phone or in person if he or I feel it necessary and has made swift referrals for investigations and to include other specialties. His calm and caring manner and the time he takes are to be commended.  
2020/21 have been tough for most of us and for healthcare workers to be facing the same personal challenges and dilemmas as the wider population while still working to so diligently demonstrates such high standards of professionalism and humility.

readBy.name: Office of Foysol Choudhury, MSP for North Edinburgh, Leith, Edinburgh Western & West Lothian

author: hoodie
title: My reiki sessions
body:
Having the peaceful time to be myself, to share my feelings, whatever they may have been, without fear or judgement in anyway. 
My feelings changed from one visit to the next, and at no time did I ever feel there was every any fear of expressing that feeling and what a relief it was to unburden, and share something valuable. 
There are many ways of reiki so Craig explained, sometimes we just talked on, I did! But then, the opportunity of the sharing of energy through the body and mind, intense calm peace and connection  with myself through him, peace yes most definitely. 
I feel sorry i have to come to an end of these very special times of sharing, but have been so thankful to have experienced them. I cannot be grateful enough to him  and to the Fern Centre for everything . I have been blessed to have been given. Thank you is not enough.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: GRAY54
title: The Fern Centre
body:
Everyone at the Fern Centre centres on people and how to help them through a really difficult time in their lives.  
Care and consideration are priorities for them.  
The treatments are excellent, covering many different aspects of recovery and by putting them together as a package increases their effectiveness.  
just a great big thank you, you have all helped to make my recovery quicker and easier.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: Woo.
title: A warm comfortable calm place to relax
body:
Really helpful to have the Fern Centre on site at the hospital.  
It is a warm comfortable calm place to relax for a while.  
Everyone I have met has been friendly and helpful, in fact I think we are very fortunate to have a place like this.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

author: JULIE04
title: Highly recommended reflexology
body:
Reflexology sessions highly recommended.  
From the first to last session I felt at ease with therapist. I am more aware of when I am holding stress and feeling under par.  
It has also made me aware of how I was suffering compared to how I feel now. It has really helped me realise that I have come a long way.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice
body: Iâ€™ve heard a lot of negative things about this surgery but I have been with them since I was born and think that they are absolutely lovely. Iâ€™m 23 and only ever had 2 issues with them! Every other time the staff and doctors are really nice and really listen to help you the best they can. Donâ€™t think some people understand the pressure they are under or the amount of work that goes into their jobs! Overall love this practice.

title: Excellent service every time
body: I have visited the A and E department several times with a history of chest pains. The staff are well trained and the Dr's show compassion. Even though I have been several times in 12 months they always take it seriously. I have been to other hospitals with the same symptoms and they still fall short compared to Sandwell hospital. Its not the nearest one to me but I will always go there as I know I will be in safe hands.

readBy.name: Sandwell and West Birmingham Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Excellence under adversity
body: The Archwood practice always has and continues to provide an excellent service. Professional, efficient and friendly - take time to explain and listens. Particularly impressed that standards have been maintained throughout, under increasingly difficult circumstances. A credit to our wonderful NHS, an exemplar local practice and a vital part of our community. Brilliant all round.

title: Dan test
body: Dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test Dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test Dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test Dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test Dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test dan test

author: Aoiyf36
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Helpful and supportive staff
body:
When I first arrived into hospital I was a lot of pain however the treatment and support of staff has really helped. At the moment I am feeling good and a lot better. Everything has been great in the surgical ward from staff being superb and so helpful.  
The cleanliness of the ward is also great which makes me feel safer due to COVID-19.  
Food is just okay however I do not have a big appetite at the moment so I havenâ€™t really been eating it a lot.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent care
body: I can't praise the care I was given here enough over my 6 day stay after surgery.The doctors and nurses were so kind and helpful . The food was not bad . Some soups were homemade. Beds very comfy. Nothing was too much trouble and to top it all, I was lucky enough to have an amazing view of the Houses of Parliament too ! That was a real tonic, watching the boats on the river and seeing parliament lit up at night.

author: humanitiesgw84
title: Above and beyond
body:
My husband has been very disabled for about a year. Kath and other nurses have visited regularly to treat him and help him with dressings and provide very good care. Kath has gone above and beyond her duty, and helped him so much, with a treatment plan ,and assisted us to access various aids for his care and well-being.  
She is caring and efficient, helped us both. My husband is almost blind, hence my writing this report. We have been so relieved to have her help and assistance.

title: Very efficient and effective
body: I have had reason to visit Crawford Street surgery with both a doctor and the nurse several times recently.  It was not difficult to get appointments, I did not have to wait to be seen and the treatment was excellent. I donâ€™t think I could have asked for more.

title: Amazing Treatment
body: I have nothing but praise for this surgery the treatment l have received is always first class and the staff are always so helpful and friendly. Thank you

author: araks37
title: Amazing experience
body: My experience with Telford Stars has been a amazing one. Jazz has helped me mentally and emotionally in a way I never thought I would ever need. She helped me get through and I am still getting such a place I never knew was possible. My daughter has put me under enormous stress and I hadn't a clue how to deal with it. Jazz is a fantastic counciler and hugely will be forever in her debt. She learned me coping strategies, understanding all about addiction and to learn to step back . 100% amazing help.

title: Gastroscopy procedure.
body:
I had a gastroscopy procedure today at Chase Farm. I was very impressed by the professionalism of all the staff,  from the reception staff, the porters, nurses and doctor. The staff were friendly, helpful and answered any questions I had. 
The procedure itself was quick and painless, and I would definitely recommend the hospital to family and friends. 
Considering we are going through Covid restrictions it was reassuring to see how cheerful the staff were coping under extra pressure.

title: Great communication between staff
body: Responded to my enquiry within two hours. Doctor called the next day. Pleasant through email communication and the lady on the phone was supportive and cared when I rang that evening. The reception team liased with two different doctors and got my medication reviewed within a day. Very impressed. Don't read all the negativity. They work so hard the receptionist, trying their best. Thank you from grateful immunesupressed patient.

author: skyxs44
title: Ubelievable amount of help
body:
I am the carer for my husband. He had a stroke three years ago. He has great difficulty walking and standing so needs 24 hour care.  
Fortunately the doctor recommended a community matron to assist with my Husband's care.  
I can not describe to you how much help having Cathrine to assist with my Husband care has been to us. He also has skin cancer problems which keep recurring, Cathrine has arranged unscheduled hospital visits to help sort out the problem. Also arranged by negotiation with the doctor for a specialised doctor to visit in our home.  
She checks up on my Husband health every month and then if needed takes the appropriate action.  
Without her help and guidance I would really struggle at times. I can not emphasise enough how valuable her assistance has been to my husband and I.

author: LLJ21
title: Pamper day
body:
I came to the paper day yesterday at Petroc. I just wanted to say a big thank you for a lovely relaxing afternoon. I had a pedicure and manicure, not having either of the treatments before. It was lovely, and the young ladies who did them were so nice.  
Also, a thank you to Jane from Seamoor Centre who I had welcome chat to.  
Then to top of all that when the treatments were finished, I was given a goodie bag, Christmas come early.

readBy.name: Royal Devon University Healthcare NHS Foundation Trust

title: Thank you
body: I recently submitted an EConsult on the King Street website after not needing to attend a GP for quite a few years.  I was really impressed to receive a next day text response from the GP requesting some further information which I duly provided.  I was then sent another text with an option of two appointment dates and times in the next two weeks.  I duly went along to the Cater Street branch where the doctor asked me to attend though this is not my usual branch (normally St Johns).  The poor receptionist was busy with a man shouting at her but remained calm.  I waited for about 5 mins before the GP came out and collected me.  She was lovely and friendly, did all the necessary and two days later I have confirmation of onward referral and tests.  Brilliant service, couldn't ask for more.  Thank you.

title: Excellent service
body: Reception staff member was extremely helpful in ensuring my mum got a face to face appointment with both her doctor and diabetic nurse and took into account my work schedule so that I could accompany her. Thank you very much

title: Excellent care
body:
In these difficult times it is so good to feel safe when visiting a hospital. 
My appointment was on time and everyone was very caring.

title: Quick, compassionate care.
body: I have been super impressed by the service at Bushloe. The receptionist found me an appointment for my son immediately and all the staff we came across were extremely kind, caring and thorough. We were so impressed by how looked after we were, and how quickly we were able to get the right treatment.

title: Friendly helpful professional
body: TÃ©lÃ©phone appointment with proactive and positive approach. I was happy with the result. Very professional and felt reassured that all my questions had been answered thoroughly

author: Sisyphus21
title: Virtual Visiting makes a huge difference
body:
Visiting patients is not possible at the hospital my mum has been admitted to. She is elderly and cannot operate a mobile phone. Without the Virtual Visiting she would be completely isolated from her family, particularly now that she picked up covid in the hospital and she has been moved to a covid ward so her stay will be much longer than anticipated. The hospital has removed their advocacy service so people with conditions like dementia really have no voice or help once they get sucked into this broken machine. A complete lack of oversight and general breakdown in communication means that finding out how a loved one is becomes a quest of unimaginable frustration, and contradiction.  
The only positive experience in all of this has been the virtual visiting service which allows family to actually see for themselves how their loved one is. It made a huge difference for my mum and for her family. We were able to reassure her that she hadn't been abandoned, that she is loved, and we can do this everyday now. Booking is really easy and the virtual visiting staff go the extra mile to help ensure the connection is decent. I feel that there is so little that vaguely works in the NHS just now, it is worth pointing out the things that do make a positive difference.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Fantastic and efficient Service
body: Quick appointment and helpful staff. Felt at ease with my treatment. Would definitely go back again.

title: Excellent care and treatment
body:
My husband received excellent care and surgical procedure in the Vascular Imaging Unit.  From the initial contact with the Admin staff to the surgery and discharge, we were treated with respect and care.
Appointments were tailored to suit our needs and follow up care was excellent.

readBy.name: York and Scarborough Teaching Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great service
body: Called the surgery as needed to see Dr, put through to friendly receptionist who took my details and concerns down. Said the Dr will review and will let me know, and by a couple of hrs later called in for a face to face consultation. Didn't have to wait long. Dr was very compassionate and took the time to listen, didn't feel rushed. Overall, very happy with the service

title: Online service easy and quick
body: I used the surgery's online econsultation service. It was simple and easy to navigate, sent through to GP. Received response quickly. Econsultation saved me a lot of time as I couldn't call in to the surgery due to work commitments.

author: augustzr96
title: Thrilled by care
body:
To the west bridgford leg ulcer clinic nurses.  
I am absolutely thrilled that in 3 weeks my wounds are clear. Its been 18 months of doctors and I've been to the nurses for 3 weeks and its healed. It will be nice to have both feet back under the covers and wear my other trousers!  
I am SO pleased.

title: Helpful, friendly, compassionate
body: I needed to get in touch with my Dr urgently for my elderly grandmother who is palliative. I spoke to one of the receptionists who passed my message on to the clinician. The same day the Dr called who was very friendly and took time to listen to my concerns. The Dr said they will follow up after a few days to check on things. I received a call back few days later. I was really happy that my grandmother's care was being looked after in the best way.

author: silverwareyy78
title: Staff really listened
body: When I first came I was feeling lost, thinking my problems were my fault and that I deserved to feel that way. Speaking to staff here that really listened and took the time to help me reflect while also validating how I felt was a major step in me feeling more hopeful for the future. I was able to recognise my role in situations while acknowledging how my childhood and relationships had shaped me. Without spending time working with the health + care services I would still be in the same cycles of behaviour, whereas new my confidence in myself has grown to have healthy relationships and boundaries. I felt like my issues mattered and my feelings were valid. Having extra sessions meant I could really explor feelings and work at coping mechanisms. there were great resources handed out as well.

readBy.name: Northern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent Practice
body:
I would rate them excellent in every area, the surgery has given my husband and I, and my son. Very very good care, the management are superb, and all staff are kind, considerate, friendly and really helpful. They are always improving in their services. We appreciate all the help we have received from them. Thank you
They now have a pharmacist at the surgery, really good.

author: hydrahj84
title: Quick care and help
body:
I would like to thank you all for all your help. I phoned this number last Wednesday morning. My husband came home from hospital after a fall on Wednesday 10-11-21 where he broke 5 ribs. He had a lot of difficulty in getting about. Nathan answered my phone call and sat the wheels in motion. I had O.T. at my door about 1 and a half hours later where they helped me with everything that I needed. Nathan phoned me back that afternoon to see if I got sorted. Which I did.  
Thankyou for all your help,

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Marvellous Practice
body:
All staff are very good, the surgery does everything it can to protect its clients from the virus, always very clean, I canâ€™t find enough words to praise them, they really care for the patients, helping in every way they can.
They are a modern updating surgery, always improving. I have already left a review, but felt I should say more. excellent. Marvellous. Efficient, kind,               to me they are all stars. Thank you

title: Fantastic department
body:
Had hysteroscopy today with local anesthetic,  I was terrified, proper scared. There was absolutely no need. I was treated with utmost care and respect. The staff were all fantastic from the nurses right through to the specialist. I was kept fully informed throughout and could not have been treated any better.
I'm a bigger lady and I didn't feel self conscious in any way, my dignity was respected at all times.
As for the procedure....there was no need to worry at all. I felt no pain and only a very small amount of discomfort. I was reassured throughout.  Afterwards I was given time to rest and a cuppa and biscuits.
Well done to everyone. I'm really grateful and want to reassure anyone having this done to try not to worry. You will be very well looked after.
Well done Alexandra Hospital...fantastic

title: Organised and caring
body: I visited the Peter Smith Surgery unit today for minor surgery. From the moment I entered Reception to when I was escorted for my lift home I experienced not only caring staff but excellent organisation. Every member of staff I encountered and there were a few were excellent. Feeling so proud of our nhs staff in the Peter Smith surgery centre, QE  Gateshead. Thank you ðŸ˜Š

author: starsg65
title: Good care
body:
I have always got good care in the health centre in the Water side Spencer Road, and the same in great james health centre Derny,  
Thankyou.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

author: Kenny66
title: Good care from various recent illnesses
body:
At the beginning of November 2020, under consultant Mr. Tsafrakidis I had a biopsy performed regarding prostate cancer. This procedure was carried out with great dignity and little pain. Thanks to consultant and his team.  
At the end of November 2020, (cardiology) . Following passing out a number of times I was treated at home by excellent paramedics. Then hospitalised and taken to cardiology at lunchtime Monday I subsequently had a pacemaker fitted the following morning and returned home by tea time. Cannot recall names or surgeons but treatment was first class.  
Then in September 2021, Following a biopsy carried out out by Dr. Amy a melanoma was detected and subsequently removed at QM hospital by consultant Mr. Ng I wish to thank him and his team of nurses for his excellent treatment.  
The post operative care for the nurses from plastic surgery responsible for care and dressings was of a very high standard.  
Then finally in November 2021, Following a CT scan carried out after the diagnosis of the melanoma an aneurism was detected in the aorta. A follow up scan was carried out by a very competent person from ninewells hospital.

readBy.name: MASScot- Melanoma Action and Support Scotland

author: bluedm99
title: Long wait for covid booster
body: 1hr 20mins to get a booster. I think the NHS needs investment. Lovely staff but the wait is a disgrace

readBy.name: Belfast Health and Social Care Trust

title: I would recommend
body: My personal experience is that whilst all go surgeries are under pressure.  This surgery does act quickly and respond to requests.  I have found them to be understanding, helpful and kind.  Not all the gpâ€™s but in general the service is very good.

author: junerg98
title: lots of good things
body:
What was good?  
-Cleanlines of the unit  
-Friendliness and professionalism of staff  
-Willingness of staff to listen to me and address my concerns/questions  
-Overall an atmosphere of quiet, confidence and warmth.  
How did these make me feel?  
-safe, valued, respected, understood.  
What could have been better?  
Maybe a printed or E.mailed summary of my condition, planned treatments and likely outcomes.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

title: Professional service
body: Amazing reassuring caring team. I canâ€™t thank the doctor and nursing team enough for their caring nature with compassion care and dignity. Felt they couldnâ€™t do enough for me to ensure they went above and beyond to make sure I was ok throughout. Thank you. Healthharmonie you are a amazing team. The nurse held my hand throughout which I wonâ€™t forget.

title: Excellent service
body: Took only 8 rings to get through. Very polite and caring receptionist who listened and even though no telephone appointments left for that day, offered the on call doctor who rang back within 3 hours. Doctor listened and took time to explain reasons for the advice given. Cannot fault the service today. As patients we should be more considerate to those under pressure at the surgeries who are only working to government guidelines, at the end of the day they are human beings too and deserve some respect

author: HenryD
title: Excellent people skills
body:
I attended an appt with Dr McVerry in Omagh hospital. I wanted to highlight that he was very understanding and explained to me the results of my CT scan since my stroke which has significantly reduced my anxiety. His people skills were excellent and he took his time with both myself and my daughter to ensure We were fully informed with all the appropriate information.  
I would like to highlight this excellent practice and how lucky service users are to have an excellent doctor looking after there care needs.

readBy.name: Western Health and Social Care Trust

title: Excellent Patient Care
body: Once again, fast, efficient and effective care from The Village Surgery.  So lucky to be registered here.  Thank you all staff for all your work during these trying times.

title: phototherapy basford
body: Useful to have this service local and in community setting. Very good staff. Good parking. Very flexible with appointment times.

title: Helpful and Caring Staff
body:
Thank you for helping me with an issue picked up from an NHS health check. Every step of the way has been a great experience which comes from all the Staff who works at Two Rivers. The pandemic has added a lot of stress for everyone in the NHS but this has not affected the help and assistance I have needed. 

Thank you.

author: caringwc96
title: Routine check
body: Routine check- A very knowledgeable, friendly yet so professional sexual health nurse called Anna was absolutely amazing and made me feel so at ease. She explained everything she was doing thoroughly and reassured my worries with pure knowledge and experience. Couldnâ€™t of asked for a better experience considering the circumstances. Sexual health is something we all need to take care of and knowing there is a local caring team to go to makes an awkward situation less mortifying.

title: Great doctors...if you can get an appointment
body:
For the third day in a row i have been unable to make an appointment - which the surgery told me to make.
If you can outside of 8am or 2pm they are helpful enough to answer questions, however getting an appointment can only be made at the above time, when calling at the above times, either its engaged as the phone system cannot queue more than 8 people or when you do eventually get through there are no slots left for that day.

Asking for any forward appointment as in not to today, is not possible, the entire situation and way the surgery manages appointments is ridiculous, the staff while sympathetic do nothing about it. How anyone who works 9-5 could ever get an appointment is beyond me as the system is broken.

title: Pointless having GP
body: Spoke to a doctor this morning , about my daughters illness , she got us to examine her over the phone ,instead of bringing her to the surgery , doctor was meant to read through daughters notes and phone back , heard nothing , yet surgery is empty and all staff standing their talking when you walk past but canâ€™t get appointment .

title: Security
body: I stopped at security this morning as we usually do,due to covid-19  and said I had an appointment at 08.50 the security said yes straight up no need to stop . On waiting for the lift I heard him saying people here can't read the sign is there  why are they asking.  Well I'm not a regular to the surgery  and that's what we had to do last year due to covid-19.  The practice is very good but I believe if people ask a question  don't be talking stupid.  Not everyone in hastings are unemployed or or drugs we are following rules. I found it disappointing to here what was said.

title: Excellent provision
body: Cannot speak highly enough of Brundall Medical Practice and its staff. Appt arranged within 90 mins and medication dispensed same morning. Exceptional health provision every time. Thank you

title: I'm looking for another GP after being here
body: Terrible service - from the antagonistic telephonists who think they are qualified to tell you whether you need to see a doctor or not, to the GPs who cannot be bothered to reply to you. Absolutely abysmal. Look for somewhere else!
